      • addAppt

        public void addAppt(char type,
                    java.util.GregorianCalendar date,
                    java.lang.String description)
        An Add Appointment method that adds an Appointment to the collection. All parameters are validated before using this method.
        Specified by:
        addAppt in interface AppointmentsInterface
        Parameters:
        type - Appointment Type, O for One Time, W for Weekly, D for Daily
        date - A GregorianCalendar Date representing the time of the Appointment
        description - The description of the Appointment.

      • displayAppt

        public java.lang.String displayAppt(int day,
                                    int month,
                                    int year)
        A Display Appointments method that returns a string representation of all the appointments that occur on the date the user enters within the collection (ArrayList). All parameters are validated before using this method.
        Specified by:
        displayAppt in interface AppointmentsInterface
        Parameters:
        day - Day of the month
        month - Month of the year
        year - the year
        Returns:
        String representation of all appointments that occur on the requested date, in the following format: Appointments on (month)/(day)/(year) (time) (description) (time) (description) Example: Appointments on 1/3/2011 1:00 PM Bday 11:59 PM Party If there are no appointments in the collection on this date, display the following: There are no appointments on (month)/(day)/(year)

      • GetAppointmentCount

        public int GetAppointmentCount()
        A method to return the number of appointments that are within the collection
        Specified by:
        GetAppointmentCount in interface AppointmentsInterface
        Returns:
        the number of appointments that are within the collection

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        A String Representation of all appointments within the collection
        Specified by:
        toString in interface AppointmentsInterface
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the String representation of all appointments within the collection in the following format: (date) (time) (description) Example January 3, 2011 1:00 PM Bday January 5, 2011 8:00 PM Gym December 31, 2010 11:59 PM Party
